# StopIO

**Instance Method**

Tells the clock device to stop I/O.

## Declaration

```swift
kern_return_t StopIO(IOUserAudioStartStopFlags in_flags);
```

## Parameters

- **in_flags**: A [doc://com.apple.audiodriverkit/documentation/AudioDriverKit/AudioDriverKit/IOUserAudioStartStopFlags] value to indicate I/O shutdown behavior.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/DriverKit/kIOReturnSuccess] on success, or another value if an error occurs. For a list of error codes, see [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/DriverKit/error-codes].

## Discussion

The default implementation always returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/DriverKit/kIOReturnSuccess].

Subclass and override this method to handle hardware-specific tasks during I/O shutdown, then call the superclass to update the I/O state. The framework expects this call to always succeed or fail.

## Performing I/O

- **StartIO**: Tells the clock device to start I/O.
- **IOUserAudioStartStopFlags**: Values that indicate I/O starts or stops.
